triples.name: Quantum chaos
triples.relevance: The paper characterizes quantum chaos in many-body systems and proposes KCP as an order parameter to distinguish chaotic from integrable behavior.

triples.name: Random matrix
triples.relevance: Spectral statistics, a key probe used in the paper to validate KCP, is fundamentally based on random matrix theory.

triples.name: Correlation function (quantum field theory)
triples.relevance: Out-of-time-order correlators (OTOCs), another diagnostic used to validate KCP, are a type of correlation function in quantum systems.

triples.name: SYK model
triples.relevance: The paper tests the KCP diagnostic on the mass-deformed and sparse variants of the SYK model, making it a central experimental system.

triples.name: Phase transition
triples.relevance: The paper proposes KCP as an order parameter, a concept from phase transition theory, to characterize quantum chaos.

triples.name: Many-body problem
triples.relevance: The paper studies Krylov complexity in many-body quantum systems to characterize chaotic and integrable transitions.

triples.name: Integrable system
triples.relevance: The paper investigates chaotic-integrable transitions by comparing KCP behavior across integrable and chaotic quantum systems.

triples.name: Krylov subspace
triples.relevance: The paper introduces Krylov complexity as a new diagnostic for quantum chaos, drawing on the mathematical concept of Krylov subspaces.
